contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your storehouses will be full" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your storehouses will be filled up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the wicked cause devastation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: devastation caused by the wicked, when it comes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Intense excitement and joy from the romantic love of one's wife is spoken of as if he was drunk from that love. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let her love control you as alcohol controls someone who is drunk" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may you be continually intoxicated by her love

contextId.occurrenceNote: Intense excitement that arises from the desire for a woman is spoken of as if he were being held captive by that woman. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "allow an adulteress to captivate you" or "allow an adulteress to fascinate you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be captivated by an adulteress

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his great foolishness leads him astray" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is led astray by his great foolishness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if someone catches him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if he is caught

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you cannot pay him enough money to change his mind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he cannot be bought off

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Before the bases of the mountains were put into place." This can also be put into active form. Alternate translation: "Before God made the foundations of the mountains and put them into their proper places" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Before the mountains were settled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "when God fixed the springs in the deep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when the springs in the deep became fixed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be put into active form. Alternate translation: "when God set the limit for the foundations of the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when there was set the limit for the foundations of the dry land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be put into active form. Alternate translation: "I will multiply your days" or "I will cause you to live many more days" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: through me your days will be multiplied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but the one who does not obey wise instruction will not have a good life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but the one who rejects correction is led astray

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God keeps away from trouble the person who does what is right" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The righteous person is kept away from trouble

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one can become safe and secure by doing what is wicked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A person cannot be established by wickedness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will overthrow the wicked people" or "People will remove the wicked people from power" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Wicked people are overthrown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will praise those who have wisdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A person is praised by how much wisdom he has

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will hate the one who always thinks evil thoughts" or "people will hate the one who takes good things and twists them into bad" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who makes perverse choices is despised

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "appetite" represents desire. Alternate translation: "diligent people will have a richly satisfied life" or "being diligent will make people richly satisfied" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the appetite of diligent people will be richly satisfied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will reward the one who respects the command" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he who respects the commandment will be rewarded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God rewards righteous people with good" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: righteous people are rewarded with good

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one who does right will receive the wealth that a sinner has stored up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a sinner's wealth is stored up for the righteous person

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but the upright enjoy favor together" or "but God's favor is experienced together among the upright" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but among the upright favor is shared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Everyone hates the poor person even his own neighbors" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The poor person is hated even by his own companions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "evil actions push over" or "evil actions destroy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is brought down by his evil actions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she makes sure people know her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she lets herself be known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "a fatted calf that someone serves with hatred" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a fatted calf served with hatred

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that is something that people despise" or "that is something that Yahweh despises" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that is something to be despised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A person should choose to get understanding more than to get silver" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: To get understanding should be chosen more than silver

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what someone has taught them" or "what they have learned" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what they are taught

contextId.occurrenceNote: This person will have a reputation of being a discerning person. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will call the one who is wise in heart discerning" or "The one who is wise in heart will have a reputation of being a discerning person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The one who is wise in heart is called discerning

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a person gains it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is gained

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A person throws the lots into his lap" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The lots are cast into the lap

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a cruel messenger will come against him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a cruel messenger will be sent against him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a bear who has just lost her cubs" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a bear robbed of her cubs

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "People even think a fool is wise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Even a fool is thought to be wise

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "people consider him to be intelligent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is considered to be intelligent

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "The tongue can lead to life of death" or "What people say can lead to life or death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Death and life are controlled by the tongue

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "many friends--they will bring him to ruin" or "many friends--his friends will destroy him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: many friends is brought to ruin by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Children inherit a house and wealth from their parents" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A house and wealth are inherited from parents

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gives a prudent wife" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a prudent wife is from Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "satisfied; nothing will harm him" or "satisfied; he will be safe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: satisfied and not afflicted by harm

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whoever drinks until they can no longer think clearly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: whoever is led astray by drink is not wise

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People know a young man by his actions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Even a youth is known by his actions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Bread that someone gained by deceit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Bread gained by deceit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People establish plans based on advice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Plans are established by advice

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his lamp will go out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his lamp will be snuffed out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh directs a person's steps" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A person's steps are directed by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "faithfulness" and "trustworthiness" can be stated as "faithful" and "trustworthy." This can also be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The king preserves himself by being trustworthy and faithful to the covenant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness preserve the king

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "When someone punishes the mocker" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When the mocker is punished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "when someone instructs the wise person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when the wise person is instructed

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Soldiers prepare horses for the day of battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The horse is prepared for the day of battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "A person should choose a good name rather than great riches" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A good name is to be chosen over great riches

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bless the one who has a generous eye" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The one who has a generous eye will be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not allow anyone to cut off your hope" or "God will keep the promises he made to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your hope will not be cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words can be translated in active form by using the term "they" which could be anyone, but are probably government officials. Alternate translation: "those whom they are taking away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are being taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) this is a simple passive that can be translated as in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will take your hope away" or 2) this is litotes that can be translated in positive form. Alternate translation: "your hope will surely continue" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: your hope will not be cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "evil report" refers to harmful things that the person will tell others. The phrase "cannot be silenced" can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will not be able to stop him from telling other people harmful things about you" or "he will tell people evil things about you and you will never have a good reputation again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: an evil report about you that cannot be silenced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "is a message that someone speaks" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is a word spoken

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone who is patient can persuade a ruler" or "Someone who is patient can speak to a ruler and change his mind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: With patience a ruler can be persuaded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "a curse on a person who does not deserve it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: an undeserved curse

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated actively. Alternate translation: "Though deception covers his hatred" or "Though he covers his hatred with deception" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Though his hatred is covered with deception

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the neighbor will consider that blessing to be a curse" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that blessing will be considered to be a curse

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a master will honor the one who protects him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who protects his master will be honored

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when one praises a person, they are also testing that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a person is tested when he is praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: "even his prayer is offensive to God." This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "God detests even his prayer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: even his prayer is detestable

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will show mercy to the one who confesses and forsakes them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who confesses them and forsakes them will be shown mercy

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bless the one who always lives with reverence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The one who always lives with reverence is blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "God will keep safe anyone who walks with integrity" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whoever walks with integrity will be kept safe

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, with the abstract noun "favor" being expressed as a verb. Alternate translation: "A person will favor the one who disciplines him more than he favors the person who flatters him with his tongue" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: Whoever disciplines someone, afterward will find more favor from him than from the one who flatters him with his tongue

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) they will receive many curses from the poor. Alternate translation: "the poor will give many curses to whoever closes his eyes to them" or 2) they will receive many curses from people in general. Alternate translation: "people will give many curses to whoever closes his eyes to the poor" or 3) they will receive many curses from God. Alternate translation: "God will give many curses to whoever closes his eyes to the poor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: whoever closes his eyes to them will receive many curses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will suddenly break him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be broken in a moment

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bless the one who keeps the law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who keeps the law is blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form."You will not be able to correct a slave simply by talking to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A slave will not be corrected by words

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "men will give honor to a person who has a humble spirit" or "a person who has a humble spirit will receive honor from men" or "Yahweh will cause men to honor a person who has a humble spirit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one who has a humble spirit will be given honor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will protect the one who trusts in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who trusts in Yahweh will be protected

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "he will prove that you are" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be proved to be

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will hold you guilty" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be held guilty

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the ravens of the valley will peck out his eyes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his eyes will be pecked out by the ravens of the valley

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the vultures will eat him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be eaten by the vultures

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "a fool who has had enough to eat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a fool when he is filled with food

contextId.occurrenceNote: That is, people rightly hated her before she married; once she marries, she will be worse than she was before she married. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "a woman whom good people have hated when she marries" or "an outcast woman when she marries" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a hated woman when she marries

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "what God has decreed" or 2) "what the kings themselves have decreed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what has been decreed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. The verb "know" is a metonym for respect. Alternate translation: "People respect her husband" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Her husband is known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will praise her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she will be praised
